Description: Large fragment from heavy basin type pottery mortarium, heavy rounded rim, groove around outside wall, spool-shaped handle. Fine, sandy yellow fabric.
Curator's comments: The production place(s) of this class of mortaria remains disputed, but probably needs to be sought in the region of Corinth / the Saronic gulf; see A. Villing and E. Pemberton, 'Mortaria from ancient Corinth: Form and function', Hesperia 79, 2010, 555-638, esp. 590-4.
Bibliographic references: Villing 2006 / 'Drab Bowls' for Apollo: The Mortaria of Naukratis and Exchange in the Archaic Eastern Mediterranean (p.33 fig.13, p. 42, no.24)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GU.04)
